application_type_full: Prior Approval: New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
decision_conditions: The proposal falls within the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 20, Class A of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 as amended. Prior approval is required and given.
| The development permitted shall be completed before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and condition A2 (2) of Schedule 2, Part 20, Class A of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 as amended.
| The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:
01 REV E: EXISTING PLANS AND ELEVATIONS PROPOSED CYCLE STORE PLAN; 02 REV E: PROPOSED PLANS AND ELEVATIONS; TRANSPORT STATEMENT

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and Schedule 2, Part 20, Class A of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015, as amended.

| A minimum of four (8) cycle parking spaces in a secure, undercover and lockable compound, as indicated on the approved plans listed under condition 2, shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the new dwellings permitted and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety be in accordance with condition A.2(1)(a) and Regulation B(18) of Class A, Part 20, Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (As Amended), policies 1.1 (f) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy T5 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| Refuse and recycling storage areas, with a combined capacity of 2200L, as indicated on the approved plans listed under condition 2 shall be provided and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the new dwellings permitted and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and policy SI 8 of the London Plan (2021).

| Prior to commencement of the development, a noise assessment report shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of external noise sources including transport/ industrial/ commercial/ cultural uses and their noise levels occurring at the site during most of the year, ie. measured during school and work weekdays. Details shall include the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications (laboratory tested including frames, seals, and any integral ventilators, approved in accordance with BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010) and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and details of self-noise). Details of internal noise levels according to BS8233:2014 shall be provided, together with best practicable mitigation measures, as necessary, to achieve the criteria for external amenity spaces.
The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the units and neighbouring amenity in accordance with A.2(1)(g) and Regulation B(18) of Class A, Part 20, Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (As Amended), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 & D14 of the London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| The rating noise level (LAr,Tr) of the individual and combined maximum noise emitted by plant, ducting and equipment at the development site shall be lower than the lowest existing background sound level by at least 10dBA, as measured at/ calculated to the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises at the development site and at surrounding premises. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014 +A1 2019, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with with A.2(1)(g) and Regulation B(18) of Class A, Part 20, Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (As Amended), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 & D14 of the London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | Prior to use, machinery, plant and equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with with A.2(1)(g) and Regulation B(18) of Class A, Part 20, Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (As Amended), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 & D14 of the London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of enhanced sound insulation values of at least 5dB above the ADE Building Regulations values, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, existing bedrooms below kitchen/dining/living room of new flats.  Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with with A.2(1)(g) and Regulation B(18) of Class A, Part 20, Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (As Amended), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 & D14 of the London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
description: Construction of additional storey to accommodate 2no. self-contained residential units. (Prior Approval Application, under Part 20, Class A)
